pageContext.claim: “So funny that The New York Times & The Washington Post got a Pulitzer Prize for their coverage (100% NEGATIVE and FAKE!) of Collusion with Russia - And there was No Collusion! So, they were either duped or corrupt? In any event, their prizes should be taken away by the Committee!”
pageContext.analysis: The Washington Post and the New York Times were awarded a Pulitzer Prize for their, "deeply sourced, relentlessly reported coverage in the public interest that dramatically furthered the nation’s understanding of Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election and its connections to the Trump campaign, the President-elect’s transition team and his eventual administration." No substantive errors were found in the articles, one of which disclosed that Trump drafted his son's misleading statement about a meeting at the Trump Tower with a Russian said to offer damaging information on Hillary Clinton.
